question.body: Which of the following is not matched correctly with its description?

multiple_choice.choice: Basophils release histamine during the inflammatory response.
Eosinophils release antibodies to prevent microbial growth.
Monocytes phagocytize microbes and tissue debris.
Neutrophils are the first to respond to a bacterial infection.

response.feedback: Incorrect. Basophils release histamine during an inflammatory response and they will move into the tissue and become Mast cells with similar function.
Correct. Eosinophils play a role in fighting parasitic infections, but B-cells secrete antibodies.
Incorrect. Monocytes are able to leave the blood and move into the tissue to digest microbes and debris.
Incorrect. Neutrophils are the first responders to a bacterial infection and they will begin to phagocytize the microbes.
